gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD.Contour
Class ContourMenuHandler

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD.Contour.ContourChangeHandler
      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD.Contour.ContourMenuHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
InformationHandler, PropertyChangeHandler, IPreserveState
public class ContourMenuHandler
extends ContourChangeHandler
implements InformationHandler

This is a module of a ContourViewComponent that is responsible for mainting the menu items associated with the view component. That is, this class maintains the state information for the menu items and listens to other modules of the view component to keep the state of the menu items synchronized with the other modules.

Nested Class Summary
 class ContourMenuHandler.MoveColorScaleListener
          This class has several menu items that are used to specify the location of the control that specifies the color scale to use when rendering the contour plot.

Constant Field Values

IS_DOUBLE_SIDED_KEY

public static final java.lang.String IS_DOUBLE_SIDED_KEY
"Is double sided key" - This static constant String is a key used for referencing whether or not this component should use a double-sided named colorscale when it uses a colorscale to determine the color to render the contour lines with. The value that this key references is a Boolean object.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ASPECT_RATIO_KEY

public static final java.lang.String ASPECT_RATIO_KEY
"Aspect ratio key" - This static constant String is a key used for referencing whether or not the aspect ratio is currently preserved for this component. The value that this key references is a Boolean.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SOLID_COLOR_KEY

public static final java.lang.String SOLID_COLOR_KEY
"Solid color key" - This static constant String is a key used for referencing the state information about the ColorControl that is used to make the contour lines colored with a solid color. The value that this key references is an ObjectState of a ColorControl object.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_PRESERVE_ASPECT_RATIO

public static final boolean DEFAULT_PRESERVE_ASPECT_RATIO
Specifies if the aspect ratio will be preserved when displaying the contour plot by default. The value of this field is the same as the value of the field ContourJPanel.DEFAULT_PRESERvE_ASPEcT_RATIO.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_IS_DOUBLE_SIDED

public static final boolean DEFAULT_IS_DOUBLE_SIDED
Specifies if the named colorscales used to determine the colors to render the contour lines with should be a double-sided contour scale by default. The value of this field is false.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_LINE_COLOR

public static final java.awt.Color DEFAULT_LINE_COLOR
Specifies the default solid color that the contour lines will be rendered using. If the field ContourJPanel.DEFAULT_COLOR_SCALE has at least one element, this field's value is the value of that element. Otherwise, this field's value is Color.BLACK

Constructor Detail

ContourMenuHandler

public ContourMenuHandler(PropertyChangeConnector connector,
                          InformationCenter center,
                          ContourJPanel panel,
                          boolean useColorScale)
Constructs a module for a ContourViewComponent that handles working with the view component's menu items.

Parameters:
connector - Serves to connect several modules of a ContourViewComponent so that if a property in one module is changed, the other modules are notified.
center - Serves as the central location where the data shared between several modules of a ContourViewComponent is stored.
panel - The panel that is responsible for rendering the contour plot.
useColorScale - If true, the colorscale specified by the parameter colorscale will be used to color the contour plot. If false, the color specified by the parameter lineColor will be used to color the contour plot.

ContourMenuHandler

public ContourMenuHandler(PropertyChangeConnector connector,
                          InformationCenter center,
                          ContourJPanel panel,
                          java.awt.Color lineColor,
                          java.lang.String colorScale,
                          boolean isDoubleSided,
                          boolean useColorScale,
                          boolean preserveAspectRatio)
Constructs a module for a ContourViewComponent that handles working with the view component's menu items.

Parameters:
connector - Serves to connect several modules of a ContourViewComponent so that if a property in one module is changed, the other modules are notified.
center - Serves as the central location where the data shared between several modules of a ContourViewComponent is stored.
panel - The panel that is responsible for rendering the contour plot.
lineColor - Specifies the initial line color that should be set in the menu items and used to render the contour lines.
colorScale - Specifies the initial colorscale that should be set in the menu items and used to render the contour lines.
isDoubleSided - If true the colorscale specified by the parameter colorscale will be a double-sided colorscale. If false, it it won't.
useColorScale - If true, the colorscale specified by the parameter colorscale will be used to color the contour plot. If false, the color specified by the parameter lineColor will be used to color the contour plot.
preserveAspectRatio - If true, the contour plot will be rendered with its aspect ratio preserved. If false, its apsect ratio will not be preserved.
Method Detail

reinit

public void reinit(IVirtualArray2D v2d)
This method is implemented for the ContourChangeHandler class. However, it does nothing. If the contour data is changed, this class does not have to change any of the menu items.

Specified by:
reinit in class ContourChangeHandler
Parameters:
v2d - The new data that is going to be plotted.
See Also:
ContourChangeHandler.reinit(IVirtualArray2D)

changeColorScaleName

public void changeColorScaleName(java.lang.String colorscale)
This method is implemented for the ContourChangeHandler class. If the colorscale being used to color the contour plot changes, this method is invoked. When it is invoked, the menu item is enabled to allow the colorscale to be specified/unspecified as a "double-sided" colorscale. In addition, the menu that contains all of the possible colorscales is enabled.

Overrides:
changeColorScaleName in class ContourChangeHandler
Parameters:
colorscale - The name of the colorscale that will now be used to color the contour plot.
See Also:
ContourChangeHandler.changeColorScaleName(String)

changeColor

public void changeColor(java.awt.Color color)
This method is implemented for the ContourChangeHandler class. If the color being used to color the contour plot changes, this method is invoked. When it is invoked, the menu item that allows the current colorscale to be specified/unspecified as a "double-sided" colorscale is disabled. In addition, the menu that contains all of the possible colorscales is disabled. This is because if a solid color is being used to color the contour plot, these options are not needed.

Overrides:
changeColor in class ContourChangeHandler
Parameters:
color - The color that is now going to be used to color the contour plot.
See Also:
ContourChangeHandler.changeColor(Color)

changeIsDoubleSided

public void changeIsDoubleSided(boolean isDoubleSided)
This method is implemented for the ContourChangeHandler class. If the colorscale being used to color the contour plot is modified to be/not be "double-sided", this method is invoked. When invoked, this method modifies the checkbox in the menus to reflect the new state of the "double-sidedness" of the colorscale.

Overrides:
changeIsDoubleSided in class ContourChangeHandler
Parameters:
isDoubleSided - True if the colorscale used to color the contour plot is now double-sided and false if it isn't.
See Also:
ContourChangeHandler.changeIsDoubleSided(boolean)
